trans-unit.source: Defines the properties and methods that must be implemented by any list control that repeats a list of items.

The IRepeatInfoUser interface defines the properties and methods that must be implemented by all list controls that repeats a list of items, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList>.

To indicate whether a list control contains a heading section, footer section, or separators, this interface defines the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.HasHeader%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.HasFooter%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.HasSeparators%2A> properties, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.RepeatedItemCount%2A> property is used to represent the number of items in the list.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.GetItemStyle%2A> method to determine the style of an item in the list.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser.RenderItem%2A> method is used to display an item.
Retrieves the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.

A list control that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface must implement the GetItemStyle method to retrieve the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that represents the style of the specified item type at the specified index in the list control.
Gets a value indicating whether the list control contains a footer section.
A list control that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface must implement the HasFooter property to indicate whether the list control contains a footer section.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list control contains a footer section; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the list control contains a heading section.
A list control that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface must implement the HasHeader property to indicate whether the list control contains a heading section.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list control contains a heading section; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the list control contains a separator between items in the list.

A list control that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface must implement the HasSeparators property to indicate whether the list control contains separators between items in the list.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list control contains a separator; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Renders an item in the list with the specified information.
A list control that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface must implement the RenderItem method to render an item in the list with the specified information.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> enumeration values.
An ordinal index that specifies the location of the item in the list control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.RepeatInfo"></xref> that represents the information used to render the item in the list.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that represents the output stream to render HTML content on the client.
Gets the number of items in the list control.
A list control that inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IRepeatInfoUser> interface must implement the RepeatedItemCount property to indicate the number of items in the control.
The number of items in the list control.
